generalSettings.sonar.login.message:
Welcome to superbank.com SonarQube.

groups.sonar-users: admin, codeviewer, issueadmin, scan, securityhotspotadmin, user

0. Default template.description: This permission template will be used as default when no other permission configuration is available

groups.sonar-administrators: admin, codeviewer, issueadmin, scan, securityhotspotadmin, user

9. Bad Template - Bad pattern.description: A wrong template whose projectKeyPattern would select a single project... at best. This is probably not the intended behavior. Templates make sense only if used for multiple projects

9. Bad template - Permission templates g.description: A bad perm template with perms granted directly to user

users.james: admin, codeviewer, issueadmin, scan, securityhotspotadmin, user
users.michal: admin, codeviewer, issueadmin, scan, securityhotspotadmin, user
users.olivier: admin, codeviewer, issueadmin, scan, securityhotspotadmin, user

9. Bad template - Permissions granted to.description: A permission template that grants permissions to Anyone (ie unauthenticated users), this is a bad practice

9. Bad template - no permissions.description: A template with no permissions granted. This makes little sense

groups.sonar-administrators: admin, applicationcreator, gateadmin, portfoliocreator, profileadmin, provisioning, scan

groups.language-experts: Language experts in charge of defining the company governance in terms of Quality Profiles (rulesets enforced in the company)
groups.project-admins: Project administrators in charge of project configuration
groups.quality-managers: Quality Managers in charge of defining company governance in terms of quality gates
groups.security-auditors: Security Auditors in charge of reviewing security issues
groups.tech-leads: Senior developers in charge of reviewing issues

java:S1451.description: Avec la meme version en francais

java:S1698.description:
Traduction francaise de la regle:
Il ne faut pas comparer les objets avec == si la methode equals n'a pas ete surchargee

python:S1721.description:
Actually in the context of an ``if``, parens are necessary:
``if value in ("foo", "bar")`` for instance

params.message: Don't write fuck or shit in code
Don't use shit or fuck in comments

params.detectionSpecification:
matching:
  pattern: "\\bCORP_SECRET_\\d{10}\\b"
  context:
     patternAround:
         pattern: "<CorpConnectionSpec>"
         maxLineDistance: 10
         maxCharDistance: 500
